name: suss
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] mainly UK (also suss (sth) out) to realize, understand, or discover something: As you've probably sussed by now, Chris likes football. The Government has sussed that middle-class parents are better at getting their children into good schools. I kept waking up with a headache and in the end I sussed what was causing it.
[ T ] mainly UK (also suss sb out) to understand what someone wants to do or what they are like: Any barmaid can suss a man like him straight away. Surely she realizes that I've sussed her?
